column3: @nopara73  "Software is a mass noun (some software, a piece of software). By non-native speakers it is sometimes erroneously treated as a countable noun (a software, some softwares)."   https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/software.  I think changing it to "an open source software" is incorrect.  Maybe "an open-source software project" is okay.  My two cents..
